intro: Zollikoferia hieracioides, commonly known as the common hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Zollikoferia hieracioides is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to different environments.
